intro: Vasconcellea sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the yellow fig or golden fig, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by edible, yellow-orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
